alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 12:23AM EDT until March 28 at 9:29AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. The rapid flow increases around 50 percent from the flood stage level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM EDT Monday the stage was 15.6 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 6.0 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
